meanings.definition: A period of time that is a smaller part of a larger period.
meanings.sent1: During the subperiod of recess, we played games outside.
meanings.sent2: The subperiod of the meeting focused on budget planning.
meanings.sent3: In the subperiod of snack time, the cookies mysteriously disappeared.
meanings.sent4: The subperiod of rain brought relief to the dry land.
meanings.sent5: The subperiod of winter felt endless with the heavy snowfall.

meanings.sent1: The subperiod of the book highlighted the protagonist's journey.
meanings.sent2: Each subperiod of the game added new challenges for the players.
meanings.sent3: The subperiod of the movie had the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The subperiod of the race determined the ultimate winner.
meanings.sent5: During the subperiod of the play, the audience held their breath in anticipation.
